# Summary

It is convenient for users to construct environments through the UI. To be able to do that, they need to be able to insert new models into simulation.

# Motivation

So users can construct worlds from the UI.

# Describe alternatives you've considered

This feature can take many forms. Some of them:

* Insert simple shapes, like on Gazebo classic. A bonus would be to choose from predefined materials that have specific physical and rendering properties.
* Insert models from [Ignition Fuel](https://app.ignitionrobotics.org/fuel/models). Typically this takes the shape of a resource browsing window, but I think if we start with the simple ability of dragging a model from a web browser to simulation, that could take us a long way with very little effort.
* Insert models from the user's computer. This could be like a resource browser widget that displays models present in a given path (like Gazebo classic's insert menu), or just the generic ability of choosing a file from a typical file browser.

# Additional context

* [Feature request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/subt/issues/130/some-suggestions-for-useful-ui) on SubT
* [Create entity service](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/143/a-6-user-command-spawn-factory-create/diff)
